description: Dive into "Whispers of Romance in Sintra" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Romance in Sintra

places.generalDescription: Sintra-Cascais Natural Park is a stunning protected area that stretches from the lush mountains of Sintra to the beautiful Guincho beach and the dramatic cliffs of Roca cape, which is known as the westernmost point of Europe. This park boasts a diverse range of environments, including forests, sand dunes, lakes, and a rugged coastline with high cliffs and picturesque beaches. It's home to many rare species of flowers and animals.

sources.snippet: Nature lovers will be in awe of the breathtaking landscapes of the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, with its forests, cliffs, and stunning beaches. Whether exploring the magnificent palaces, immersing yourself in the town's rich history, or simply basking in the magical atmosphere, a visit to Sintra is an unforgettable experience that will transport you to a world of wonder and beauty.
sources.shortName: boutique hotels and holiday homes Sintra, Portugal

sources.snippet: Here, you can explore the enchanting outdoors with your special someone. Meander through scenic Sintra romantic walking trails, breathe in the fresh air and let the rugged beauty of the park draw you closer. The rugged cliffs, stunning beaches, and lush forests offer the perfect backdrop for your intimate adventure.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra

sources.snippet: The small city is literally on the edge of Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, one of over a dozen protected natural parks throughout Portugal. And if you‚Äôve been paying attention, you know I love me some nature.
sources.shortName: The Prettiest F*cking Sintra, Portugal Travel Guide You've Ever Seen‚ÄîAKA: Isn't It Romanti...cism?

places.name: Parque Natural de Sintra-Cascais

reviews.text: Beautiful place , but unfortunately packed with tourists. Makes the whole experience of visiting stressful, especially if you go inside the castle, you cannot actually enjoy because people are in a line behind you. Going down we went thru the forest which was not easy, but with unexpected discoveries.

It's pretty cool seeing the outside although today there's construction on and it's definitely not as dramatic as seeing it 5 years ago. But you've come all the way to Sintra. See it. I skipped the interior this time. Not that great.
This was a great experience.  Our tour guide was so knowledgeable about the history.  We enjoyed it so much. It was beautiful ü§©!

places.generalDescription: Quinta da Regaleira is a fascinating early 20th-century palace and garden complex located in Portugal. Originally purchased by the eccentric millionaire Antonio Augusto Carvalho Monteiro, it was designed by Italian architect Luigi Manini, showcasing a blend of Romanesque, Gothic, Renaissance, and Manueline architectural styles. The estate is adorned with hidden symbols related to Templar Knights, Masonry, and the Rose-Cross.

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs hard to resist the allure of Sintra‚Äôs famous palaces ‚Äì the Pal√°cio da Pena, the Castelo dos Mouros and Quinta da Regaleira ‚Äì yet there are several other spaces and activities in the town and surrounding Parque Natural Sintra-Cascais that offer equally showstopping experiences but with fewer crowds.
sources.shortName: Top 10 things to do in Sintra
A Couple‚Äôs Guide To Sintra, Portugal

sources.snippet: A Quinta da Regaleira and its palace are probably the most enigmatic and mystical places in Sintra. Built at the beginning of the 20th century by millionaire Ant√≥nio Carvalho Monteiro (also known as Monteiro dos Milh√µes), the building is an example of the romantic revivalist style that combines Gothic, Manueline and Renaissance elements, but also a lot of esoteric symbolism. On the estate, covered in lush vegetation, the Chapel of the Holy Trinity and, above all, the famous enigmatic well with its iconic spiral staircase stand out‚Ä¶ among other secrets about this fantastic farm.
sources.shortName: Sintra: 16 Must-see Sites

sources.snippet: Cost: 11‚Ç¨; Lisboa Card offers a 20% discountHours: May to September 10 am to 7:30 pm, last entrance at 5:30 pm; October through April 10 am to 6:30 pm, last entrance at 5:30 pmWebsite:regaleira.ptFood: There is a caf√© next to the palace that serves food and drinks in a shady, garden like setting. PRO TRAVEL TIP: Purchase your ticket online in advance to save the wait in the ticket line. You may still have to wait in line to enter the estate (we had a 10-minute wait at 10:10 am, which was just after it opened; at 11 am, there was no line to enter the estate).
sources.shortName: 13 Amazing Things to Do in Sintra, Portugal (2024 Guide

sources.snippet: The mystical Quinta da Regaleira, with its beautiful gardens and mysterious initiation wells, adds an air of mysticism to the town. Nature lovers will be in awe of the breathtaking landscapes of the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, with its forests, cliffs, and stunning beaches. Whether exploring the magnificent palaces, immersing yourself in the town's rich history, or simply basking in the magical atmosphere, a visit to Sintra is an unforgettable experience that will transport you to a world of wonder and beauty.
sources.shortName: boutique hotels and holiday homes Sintra, Portugal

sources.snippet: The Quinta da Regaleira was built at the end of the 19th century with the romantic spirit and ideals. This fascinating set of buildings and lush garden is the reflection of the philosophical and initiatory interests of its owner, Ant√≥nio Augusto Carvalho Monteiro, allied to the talent of the architect-scenographer Luigi Manini. More than a touristic tour, visiting Quinta da Regaleira is to travel in an imaginary universe of symbols and metaphors.
sources.shortName: 5 places not to be missed in Sintra

sources.snippet: Once known as the ‚ÄúPalace of the Millions,‚Äù the aristocratic residence of the Regaleira estate was built by an eccentric millionaire who wanted the most exquisite of homes. He ended up creating a mystical place that includes a park with an enigmatic system of tunnels, that has been turned into one of Sintra‚Äôs most intriguing and most popular attractions. See the Quinta da Regaleira Guide.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Sintra Attractions and Things to Do

sources.snippet: If you're seeking an enchanting escape with your loved one in Sintra, don't miss Quinta da Regaleira. As you wander through its mysterious tunnels and climb the spiral Initiation Well, you'll uncover secrets and share the thrill of discovery. The romantic aura of hidden grottoes and the mystical vibes make it one of the top Sintra date night spots.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra

sources.snippet: Being the √Åguamel Sintra located in the historical center of the village only five minutes walk from the Quinta da Regaleira, we suggest there to be the first place to visit. It will take at least 3 hours to explore the palace, the caves and the underground tower, as well as its splendid garden. Credits: Quinta da Regaleira
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaway in Sintra

sources.snippet: Quinta da Regaleira is a fascinating estate that boasts a palace, lush gardens, and mysterious grottoes. Known for its Gothic, Renaissance, and Manueline architectural styles, it's particularly famous for its enigmatic Initiation Wells, which are believed to have been used for Masonic ceremonies.
sources.shortName: SINTRA, THE MOST ROMANTIC VILLAGE IN PORTUGAL

sources.snippet: In addition, Quinta da Regaleira is a magical and enchanting place where you can explore the mysteries and beauties of architecture, nature and culture. It's the perfect setting for a romantic getaway, where you can experience an unforgettable adventure with your loved one.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Sintra for Couples, 2024

sources.snippet: Quinta da Regaleira and especially its gardens are stunning. The work of Italian architect Luigi Manini, also the author of the Bu√ßaco Hotel Palace, created a romantic-style palace and a garden in which each element has a different meaning. QUINTA DA REGALEIRA (press here)
sources.siteName: ScannerTrip - Travel Blog | Tips and hints for your vacation
sources.shortName: Sintra: what to visit in this romantic village in Portugal

sources.snippet: Another must-visit palace is the Quinta da Regaleira, an architectural wonder that exudes mystery and mystique. The palace‚Äôs gardens are a labyrinth of hidden tunnels, grottoes, and fountains, making it perfect for an intimate and adventurous stroll with your partner.
sources.shortName: Portugal: 5 romantic things to do in Sintra

sources.snippet: Another surprisingly peaceful park to explore is the Quita da Regaleira, a four-hectare estate with tunnels, mazes, grottos and water features.
sources.shortName: A couple‚Äôs guide to Sintra ‚Äì Portugal‚Äôs most romantic city

sources.snippet: If you are a fan of the world of magic and of the occult, Quinta da Regaleira is a must see stop on your visit to Sintra.
sources.shortName: Sintra: Romance and Magic, just 15 minutes away from Lisbon

Sintra Village is One Of The Most Romantic Places on Earth
Sintra - Portugal Magik

places.name: Quinta da Regaleira

reviews.text:
This is one place in Sintra that you have to visit before anywhere else! I guarantee you won't be disappointed! It was the absolute highlight of our holiday! We absolutely loved this place!
I wouldn't hesitate to go back to this stunning place again and again if I were to return to Portugal. I would call this place ‚ÄúFairytale Land‚Äù it had beautiful architecture everywhere, fairytale towers that you could climb up via spiral staircases, manicured gardens, woodland walks, out of this world initiation wells and an abundance of underground caves! Once you are inside, the place is so vast, you could not possibly get bored. The initiation well was absolutely awesome which led you to the first series of underground caves. It was just one splendour after another. Then when you thought you had seen most things you would stumble upon another underground caves network (without lighting) so the torch on your phone will come in handy! Honestly I think this is one of the loveliest places we have been to. I was excited to be there and the beauty and splendour of this place was simply jaw dropping!
The queue system wasn't so great mind. Definitely book a ticket in advance. Then go to the front of the queue- as there seemed to be two queues- one for the current time slot - then a second queue for later time slots. To get in you have to go to the front queue (which tends to be quite short) . However the second queue will just leave you getting nowhere fast!

Lovely visit in the morning & before the big groups arrive.

We were all very impressed by the well & beautiful gardens.

The palace has amazing woodwork & detail.

Nice cafe to relax for a coffee, cake & recharge.

Another top attraction from Sintra, this place is amazing as well! The gardens are absolutely gorgeous and so relaxing comforting. The view is also breath taking.

I recommend buying tickets in advance because they are very strict with the hours and if you don't come at exactly the time selected on your ticket you may wait a long time to get in. The value for money is very good. I definitely recommend this place!

places.generalDescription: The National Palace of Sintra, dating back to the 11th century, showcases a remarkable collection of tiles and features intricate courtyards and rooms. Situated amidst lush greenery and hunting areas, this historic palace holds over 1000 years of Portuguese history and was favored by many monarchs due to its proximity to Lisbon. The Coat of Arms room is a must-see among the unique chambers within the palace.

sources.snippet: Go for a hike and climb to the medieval Castle of the Moors, built in the 8th century, or take a cozy bus ride up and hike back down after exploring each stone corner. The sights from this vantage point are also phenomenal, and the green woods are peaceful and beautiful.
sources.shortName: A Couple‚Äôs Guide To Sintra, Portugal

sources.snippet: With Arab origins,Sintra National Palace, in the heart of the town, has been the residence of the Portuguese royal family since the 12th century. It is a unique example of Portuguese medieval palaces, but it reveals different architectural styles (reflecting the taste of different kings), ranging from Gothic to Mudejar and Manueline. Don‚Äôt miss the chapel, the kitchens with their large conical chimneys, but also the Swan, Coat of Arms and Handle rooms.
sources.shortName: Sintra: 16 Must-see Sites

sources.snippet: One of the few medieval palaces in the world that remains practically intact, this royal residence was once home to Prince Henry the Navigator. It features two gigantic conic chimneys, rising up from a kitchen where banquets (or actual food orgies) were prepared. The interior presents beautifully-painted ceilings and a room almost entirely covered in blue-and-white tile panels.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Sintra Attractions and Things to Do

sources.snippet: The National Palace of Sintra dominates the landscape with its iconic chimneys, symbolizing the essence of the area. Dating back to the Arab occupation, the millennia-old history of the Pa√ßo da Vila de Sintra unfolds through various architectural phases. While it frequently hosted the court, it was never a permanent residence, yet it always boasted luxurious decorations.
sources.shortName: 5 places not to be missed in Sintra

sources.snippet: Also known as the Town Palace, Pal√°cio da Vila is distinguished by its two large conical chimneys and extensive tilework. It's a mix of Moorish and Manueline architecture, with interiors that showcase impressive examples of azulejos (traditional Portuguese tiles). This palace is steeped in history, having been a residence for Portuguese royalty for centuries.
sources.shortName: SINTRA, THE MOST ROMANTIC VILLAGE IN PORTUGAL

sources.snippet: This was used by the Portuguese royal family and has medieval, Gothic, Renaissance and romantic characteristics. It is located in a privileged location, close to the central area of ‚Äã‚Äãthe village, being a mandatory stop for all visitors. Several secrets can be found in it, such as the well that never runs dry and that served the residents of the palace.
sources.siteName: ScannerTrip - Travel Blog | Tips and hints for your vacation
sources.shortName: Sintra: what to visit in this romantic village in Portugal

sources.snippet: Just outside Sintra, the 19th century Pena National Palace is another gorgeous former royal residence and a wonderful example of 19th century Romanticism. However, the original palace was built by the Moors and the courtyards with water features and surmounted arches around the windows still reflect the designs of the original Moorish craftsmen.
sources.shortName: A couple‚Äôs guide to Sintra ‚Äì Portugal‚Äôs most romantic city

sources.snippet: The Sintra National Palace is literally the oldest palace in all of Portugal. Also, nearly every king and queen of Portugal used it as their residence. While nowhere near as extensive as, and without the elaborate gardens of Pena Palace or Monserrate, it‚Äôs definitely worth the visit, especially since it‚Äôs close to old town.
sources.shortName: The Prettiest F*cking Sintra, Portugal Travel Guide You've Ever Seen‚ÄîAKA: Isn't It Romanti...cism?

sources.snippet: Relics from the Middle Ages (like the Sintra National Palace) or from Portugal‚Äôs Islamic past (like the Castle of the Moors) played in to the age‚Äôs prevailing Revivalism) and Orientalism. And Sintra‚Äôs dramatic, rugged setting caused the emotions of the Romantics to run wild.
sources.shortName: Sintra, Portugal: Lisbon‚Äôs Romantic-Era Getaway

sources.snippet: Cost: 13‚Ç¨Hours: 9:30 am to 6:30 pm; last entry at 6 pmWebsite:parquesdesintra.pt. The National Palace of Sintra is the oldest palace in Portugal. The first palace was constructed around the 10th and 11th centuries, when the area was under Moorish rule.
sources.shortName: 13 Amazing Things to Do in Sintra, Portugal (2024 Guide

sources.snippet: You can visit the National Palace of Sintra, which is the oldest in the country and has Gothic and Manueline architecture, with rooms decorated with tiles and paintings. The highlight is the two conical chimneys that rise above the kitchen.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Sintra for Couples, 2024

sources.snippet: Additionally, we have down in the old village, the Sintra National Palace and the Regaleira Palace and Gardens. There‚Äôs much more if time allows, such as Queluz Palace, Monserrate, Capuchos and even Cabo da Roca, European Westernmost Point.
sources.shortName: Sintra - Portugal Magik

places.name: National Palace of Sintra

reviews.text: This is a very nice and peaceful place. Not so popular and advertised like the other favorites in Sintra but definitely worth the time. I like it's simplicity, originality and modesty. The garden is outstanding from any angle. I definitely recommend this attraction!

Amazing palace and the history is fascinating, the kitchen was my favourite room! We only had a few hours and weren't sure if we could do it in time. Only went in at 16:30 but still managed to see everything before they closed. Loved it ‚ù§Ô∏è

This palace is nice, many rooms and areas to visit and views form the balconies and gardens of the hills and another castles in Sintra. A lot of history to be told here and a nice walk through all the facilities. Nonetheless, I take out 1 star for the elevated price, in my opinion too much for what is has to offer. They take advantage of tourists and it is clearly overpriced. Another star out because several rooms had all the items (furniture, statues paintings) covered in plastic for restoration, but they did not mention this at the entrance and all the same charge full price in the ticket. Shame on them.

places.address: Largo Rainha Dona Am√©lia, 2710-616 Sintra, Portugal

places.generalDescription: The Moorish Castle, constructed in the 10th century, sits atop a cliff in Sintra and offers breathtaking panoramic views. It played a significant role during the Reconquista and was built during the period of Muslim Iberia. The castle is part of the beautiful Sintra-Cascais Nature Park and is surrounded by other historic sites such as Pena Palace, Quinta da Regaleira, and Convent of the Capuchos.

sources.snippet: With its fairytale-like palaces, such as the iconic Pena Palace and the Moorish Castle, Sintra offers a glimpse into a bygone era of opulence and architectural splendor. The historic center of Sintra, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is a maze of narrow streets lined with charming shops and cozy cafes. The mystical Quinta da Regaleira, with its beautiful gardens and mysterious initiation wells, adds an air of mysticism to the town.
sources.shortName: boutique hotels and holiday homes Sintra, Portugal

sources.snippet: Resembling a smaller ‚ÄúGreat Wall of China,‚Äù this castle takes visitors back 1200 years, to a time when the Moors conquered much of the lands of the Iberian Peninsula. It survived a number of earthquakes and fires, as well as the reconquest of Sintra by Christian Crusaders in the 12th century. Restored in the 1800s when Pena Palace was built, it‚Äôs a romantic sight where everyone goes for the most breathtaking views of Sintra.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Sintra Attractions and Things to Do

sources.snippet: Cost: ‚Ç¨12Hours: 9:30 am to 6 pm, last entry at 5:30 pmWebsite:parquesdesintra.ptGetting Here: The entrance is located on Estrada da Pena, the same one-way road to Pena Palace, 350 meters before the entrance into Pena Palace. It is a 5 to 10-minute walk between Pena Palace and the Moorish Castle.Time: 1 to 2 hoursGetYourGuide: You can also purchase your ticket on GetYourGuide. The Moorish Castle | Best Things to Do in Sintra
sources.shortName: 13 Amazing Things to Do in Sintra, Portugal (2024 Guide

sources.snippet: When you plan a romantic getaway to Sintra, the Moorish Castle is a place you must see. This historical gem offers you and your partner an opportunity to explore the past while creating unforgettable memories. The best time for a romantic trip to Sintra is undoubtedly enhanced by the sense of adventure and awe you'll feel while taking in the rich history and panoramic vistas of the Moorish Castle.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra

sources.snippet: The Castelo dos Mouros is a military fortification of the 10th century, built by the Muslim populations that occupied the Iberian Peninsula. It occupies a fundamental strategic position, playing an important role in the defense of the local territory and the maritime accesses to the city of Lisbon. The walls adapt to the zigzag terrain, climbing over rocky blocks and surrounded by a dense forest.
sources.shortName: 5 places not to be missed in Sintra

sources.snippet: Built on a rocky peak in the Serra de Sintra, possibly between the 8th and 9th centuries, the Moorish Castle bears witness to the Islamic presence in the region. After the Christian reconquest, it was enlarged and reinforced several times. As well as being a historical monument, today it is also an incredible viewpoint, overlooking the town of Sintra and the surrounding region.
sources.shortName: Sintra: 16 Must-see Sites

sources.snippet: From the old medieval Village, climb the mountain up to the Pena National Palace and explore the Moorish Castle. Additionally, we have down in the old village, the Sintra National Palace and the Regaleira Palace and Gardens. There‚Äôs much more if time allows, such as Queluz Palace, Monserrate, Capuchos and even Cabo da Roca, European Westernmost Point.
sources.shortName: Sintra - Portugal Magik

sources.snippet: If you fancy a bit of adventure, you can climb up to the Moorish Castle, a medieval fortress dating back to the 8th century. The castle has a 450 metre wall, which follows the relief of the mountains and offers a panoramic view of the region. You can walk along the ramparts, see the towers and cisterns and feel the historic atmosphere of the place.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Sintra for Couples, 2024

sources.snippet: Very close to the Pena National Palace are the walls of the Moorish Castle. This one stands out for the fact that the walls were built on the rocks of the mountain range and for its view over Sintra, the mountains and the sea. More about MOORISH CASTLE (Press Here)
sources.siteName: ScannerTrip - Travel Blog | Tips and hints for your vacation
sources.shortName: Sintra: what to visit in this romantic village in Portugal

sources.snippet: This is considered one of the most beautiful places in Sintra. At the top of its mountain range, this nineteenth-century building expresses romanticism and invites you to learn more about the history and magic of Sintra.
sources.shortName: Sintra: Romance and Magic, just 15 minutes away from Lisbon

places.name: The Moorish Castle

reviews.text: Great for a walk. Starting from the train station, we followed the pathway up through the wooded gardens and on to the castle ruins.  Offers great views and a shaded tree lined walk up.  There are several routes to the top, some more paved than others.  But all very scenic.  Worth a visit.

Amazing experience!! Better than the palace in our opinion. You feel like you're on top of the world and it's quite quiet! Lovely walking around, amazing views from every angle!! Can buy tickets there for ‚Ç¨12 per adult. 100% worth it to walk on the castle walls

We visited the place in very hot weather, the humidity was very high, so it was not easy to climb the stairs. Not to mention getting up to the entrance. But the view is definitely worth it, the whole area is visible and there is a nice view of the Pena Palace.

places.generalDescription: Ursa Beach is a hidden gem that beckons adventurous souls with its stunning golden sands and dramatic rock formations. Nestled near Cape Roca, this secluded paradise can be reached via a steep trail that promises breathtaking views along the way. The journey to Ursa Beach is not for the faint-hearted, as it involves a challenging hike, but those who make the trek are rewarded with an awe-inspiring landscape reminiscent of a movie set.
places.name: Ursa Beach

reviews.text:
It is one of the most beautiful beaches I have been to in Portugal. The cliffs are amazing and the whole beach feels like another world.
One of the things is that while it is amazing, there were also huge waves so it was difficult to actually go to the ocean.
Another thing is the way to the beach. The way up isn't bad but the way down was harder. It was very steep and slippery and took us a while. Do not recommend for elderly or for too young children. Otherwise the experience was wondeful.

Wonderful, a must-visit place!
You can only reach it on foot, and the path is quite steep, so be prepared with proper shoes and a windbreaker (even in summer). Once you're down there, definitely wade into the water a bit ‚Äì feeling the waves is pure joy.
What a lovely hike! Just make sure you have enough time (30 min each way) and it's steep so shoes are a must

places.generalDescription: The National Palace of Pena, located in Sintra, Portugal, is a 19th-century Romanticist palace situated on a high rock and former monastery site surrounded by parkland. The palace was commissioned by King Ferdinand II as a summer residence for the Portuguese royal family and was designed by Prussian architect Ludwig von Eschwege. It features a mix of architectural styles including Neo-Gothic, Neo-Manueline, Neo-Islamic, and Neo-Renaissance.

sources.snippet: Perhaps the most popular reason why visitors head to Sintra is to tour the many palace and manor estates that have given the town its ‚Äúfairytale‚Äù reputation, with the 19th-century Pena Palace easily being the most romantic of the bunch. Sitting at the top of one of the highest mountains, the Pena Palace offers some of the best views in Sintra, and the gardens and woods around the estate add to the beauty on-site. Other showstoppers include the Quinta da Regaleira, Monserrate Palace, and the Palace of Sintra.
sources.shortName: A Couple‚Äôs Guide To Sintra, Portugal

sources.snippet: Perched atop the hill, Pena National Palace stands out in the landscape, embodying the romantic essence of Sintra. In the late 18th to early 19th century, Romanticism flourished across Europe. In Portugal, it found expression through Ferdinand of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha, later known as Dom Fernando II upon marrying Queen Dona Maria II. During a visit in the mid-19th century, Dom Fernando II was captivated by Sintra‚Äôs scenery, leading him to acquire a former monastery and its surroundings for a royal summer retreat.
sources.shortName: 5 places not to be missed in Sintra

sources.snippet: O Pena Palace is one of Sintra‚Äôs (and Portugal‚Äôs) greatest landmarks, and the surrounding park are the ultimate exponent of romantic revivalism in Portugal. Located on Monte da Lua, right at the top of the Serra de Sintra, it was born from the imagination of King Ferdinand and became a real fairytale palace, perched on huge rocks. One of its most striking features is the mixture of architectural styles, from romanticism to neo-Gothic, including neo-Moorish and neo-Manueline.
sources.shortName: Sintra: 16 Must-see Sites

sources.snippet: With its fairytale-like palaces, such as the iconic Pena Palace and the Moorish Castle, Sintra offers a glimpse into a bygone era of opulence and architectural splendor. The historic center of Sintra, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is a maze of narrow streets lined with charming shops and cozy cafes. The mystical Quinta da Regaleira, with its beautiful gardens and mysterious initiation wells, adds an air of mysticism to the town.
sources.shortName: boutique hotels and holiday homes Sintra, Portugal

sources.snippet: The Neuschwanstein castle in Bavaria may be an iconic image of Europe‚Äôs romantic architecture, but before that famous German fantasy there was this Portuguese fairytale in Sintra. It was a dream-come-true for a king, built on the site of a ruined monastery at the top of a mountain, blending different architectural styles. It resulted in one of Europe‚Äôs most spectacular buildings and one of its finest romantic constructions.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Sintra Attractions and Things to Do

sources.snippet: Although ‚ÄúPena‚Äù is usually left untranslated in this palace‚Äôs name, pena in Portuguese means something like ‚Äúrocky hilltop‚Äù‚Äîbut Rocky Hilltop National Palace just doesn‚Äôt have quite the same ring to it. Built in the 1800s over the ruins of a monastery and chapel, it was the favored (but short-lived) summer residence of the king and queen of Portugal between 1854 and 1889, when the palace was purchased by the state.
sources.shortName: Sintra, Portugal: Lisbon‚Äôs Romantic-Era Getaway

sources.snippet: Cost: ‚Ç¨10 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨20Shuttle: ‚Ç¨3Audio Guide: ‚Ç¨1.09 Hours: Park da Pena is open from 9 am to 7 pm; the palace is open from 9:30 am to 6:30 pm; last entry is 6 pmWebsite:parquesdesintra.pt. Pena Palace is the #1 attraction in Sintra. This UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the Seven Wonders of Portugal is famous for its mountain top setting, its whimsical blend of architectural styles, and its vibrant colors.
sources.shortName: 13 Amazing Things to Do in Sintra, Portugal (2024 Guide

sources.snippet: Another unmissable palace is the Pena Palace, which sits on top of a hill and has spectacular views. The palace is a mixture of styles, colours and shapes that reflect the personality of King Ferdinand II, who had it built in the 19th century. You can admire the gardens, fountains, lakes and sculptures that surround the palace and explore its interior, which preserves period furniture and objects.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Sintra for Couples, 2024

sources.snippet: Just outside Sintra, the 19th century Pena National Palace is another gorgeous former royal residence and a wonderful example of 19th century Romanticism. However, the original palace was built by the Moors and the courtyards with water features and surmounted arches around the windows still reflect the designs of the original Moorish craftsmen.
sources.shortName: A couple‚Äôs guide to Sintra ‚Äì Portugal‚Äôs most romantic city

sources.snippet: At the top of the Sintra Hill, we glimpse the jewel in Sintra‚Äôs crown. The Pena National Palace and the park that surrounds it have been a World Heritage Site since 1995 and a National Monument since 1910. It is an extravagant palace in bright colours with various architectural structures that appeal to the medieval imagination.
sources.siteName: ScannerTrip - Travel Blog | Tips and hints for your vacation
sources.shortName: Sintra: what to visit in this romantic village in Portugal

sources.snippet: This enchanting palace offers you and your partner a dreamlike setting for your Sintra romantic getaway ideas. With its vibrant colours and intricate architecture, Pena Palace ignites the flames of romance. Wander through the palace's unique interiors, explore the beautiful gardens, and bask in the sweeping views together.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra

sources.snippet: The Pena Palace, perched on a hilltop with its vibrant colors and whimsical design, is undoubtedly the crown jewel of Sintra. It is my personal favorite. As you explore its turrets, terraces, and hidden passages, you‚Äôll feel like you‚Äôve stepped into a fantasy world.
sources.shortName: Portugal: 5 romantic things to do in Sintra

sources.snippet: Perched high atop the hill, the Pena Palace, is the most sought-after monument, and with good reason. It is the epitome of romanticism in architecture!. The colorful turrets and sweeping views from this fairytale-like castle are truly breathtaking!.
sources.shortName: SINTRA, THE MOST ROMANTIC VILLAGE IN PORTUGAL
Sintra Village is One Of The Most Romantic Places on Earth

sources.snippet: Bed and breakfast place in Sintra, seen on the way to the Pena Palace, just beside the ‚ÄúJohnny Depp‚Äù house
sources.shortName: Magical Weekend Getaway in Sintra
The Prettiest F*cking Sintra, Portugal Travel Guide You've Ever Seen‚ÄîAKA: Isn't It Romanti...cism?
Sintra, Romantic Portuguese Destinations
Sintra - Portugal Magik

places.name: National Palace of Pena

reviews.text:
Indeed I can admit it's impressive! You feel exactly like in a fairy tale. The castle is huge, beautiful and outstanding! The interior also does not disappoint because the rooms are magical. The staff is highly organized a d helpful.

Please bare in mind to buy tickets in advance and always I mean always arrive at the time you selected when buying the tickets, otherwise you will wait hours because they don't let you go inside any time earlier. They are very strict with the timing. I can't blame them because there are hundreds of people waiting to get inside at any hour.

Overall it was a very nice experience, one of the top 5 from Lisbon and surroundings.

Simply lovely! A wonderful place to take a hike. Loved the vivid colors and the cool architectures. The view from the top of the building is also amazing! Though be careful the wind could be quite strong on the top of the hill, and if you have a fear of height maybe not challenge yourself with the walk outside around the castle (if not, then definitely try it! so cool!). The wait to enter the building is crazy long though, better plan your trip in advance! Definitely cool place!

This was the highlight of our trip- we visited in May on my birthday and it was the perfect outing for someone who enjoys history and the outdoors. There was no queue when we arrived and I would recommend (if you're staying in Lisbon) to get an uber from Lisbon to Palace of Pena and then walk back down because once you've made a trek up then then you have the rest of the park to visit which is quite large! Some beautiful views and very peaceful in some areas, I would love to visit again one day.

places.generalDescription: Casa Piriquita is a renowned local institution in Sintra, satisfying sweet cravings for over 160 years. Founded by Amaro dos Santos and his wife Constancia Gomes, the bakery initially gained fame for baking Queijada, a cupcake-like pastry enjoyed by King Carlos. Later, their niece Constancia Cunha introduced Travesseiro, a pastry filled with sweet eggs and almonds.

sources.snippet: The Portuguese are known for their love of desserts, and this is THE spot in town for sweets. It is always packed, so just grab a number and get in line. We decided in the name of research, we needed to try a few options.
sources.shortName: Guide to the Best of Sintra: How to Spend 1 or 2 Days

sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Sintra for Couples, 2024

places.name: Casa Piriquita

reviews.text:
A fun, fast stop where I could have lingered far longer than we did. Located near the square where the National Palace is located.

There is a take out counter- the line was long. But we sat down for some delicious Portuguese pastries. Excellent stop.

Upon arriving in Sintra, we stepped into Casa Piriquita for breakfast. We tried their most famous dessert, and we were very satisfied with its quality. The pastry was fresh and flavorful, living up to its reputation. The place was quite busy, and it took us a while to find a seat, but the experience was still enjoyable. Despite the crowd, the atmosphere remained pleasant, and the service was efficient. It was a nice start to our day, and we'd recommend stopping by for anyone visiting Sintra, especially if you're looking to try local pastries.
Authentic food prices from ‚Ç¨1.50-2 for really lovely pastries. There is a bit of a wait to sit down but it's a really cute experience and if you go you have to try the Travesseiro!

places.generalDescription: Located at an impressive 488 meters above sea level, the Sanctuary of Peninha is a Baroque chapel and early-1900s palace situated on a rugged outcrop. From this vantage point, visitors can enjoy sweeping views of the Atlantic coast and the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park. Originally a shrine for Christian pilgrims seeking fertility, it was later expanded into a summer residence before being acquired by the Moon Company. Plans are underway to restore its historical significance and former beauty.

sources.snippet: Overlooking Cabo da Roca, at an altitude of almost 500 meters, the Peninha site is one of the most surprising places in the Sintra mountains, not only for its incredible views, but also for the buildings it houses. There is a sanctuary there that dates back to the time when the kingdom of Portugal was formed (the current chapel dates back to the 17th century) and a romantic revival-style mansion built in 1918. A municipal heritage site, it does not welcome visitors inside, so it can only be seen from the outside.
sources.shortName: Sintra: 16 Must-see Sites

sources.snippet: Tucked away in the enchanting hills of Sintra, Peninha Sanctuary beckons to you with its awe-inspiring mountaintop views and the whispering secrets of the winds. This secluded gem, steeped in history and surrounded by a tapestry of green, is the perfect backdrop for an intimate escape, where you can lose yourselves in each other's company amidst nature's timeless embrace. Location: Sintra, Portugal.Best Things to Do:
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra

places.name: Sanctuary of Peninha

reviews.text:
Haven't been there for a while and it really surprised me! Beautiful scenery (specially going uphill from Malveira da Serra and a lot to explore on the top of the hill from the old monastery to many walks.
Found out that semi wild horses and cows were introduced there in 2022. Was very nice to see them and explore around even with the fast changing weather.

Portugal offers lots of opportunities to be close to nature. This time, we decided to explore Sintra with company called Greentrekker for a Sunday walk in the nature reserve. We saw enchanted forest with big stone formations, best views of the valley and ocean, and even visited centuries old woman monastery. Our guide was amazing, passionate about nature, environment and I really loved it. We saw lots of people doing trail running and cycling. Amazing place
Best view in Sintra. Worth visiting

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the Sintra Nature Reserve, the Park and Palace of Monserrate is an extravagant 19th-century mansion adorned with Moorish, Gothic, and Indian architectural influences. The Neo-Gothic mansion is surrounded by beautifully landscaped gardens featuring a diverse collection of ferns and captivating follies. Visitors can explore the opulent interiors of the house before strolling through the lush gardens.

sources.shortName: A Couple‚Äôs Guide To Sintra, Portugal

sources.snippet: Built in 1856 as a summer residence for Francis Cook, the Monserrate Palace is one of the most incredible creations of romanticism. The interior reveals elegant and lavish spaces, such as the Gallery (the corridor that connects the palace‚Äôs three towers), the music room, the dining room and the library. Surrounding the palace, Monserrate Park is home to a remarkable botanical collection with species from all over the world, which blend in with the native vegetation over 50 hectares.
sources.shortName: Sintra: 16 Must-see Sites

sources.snippet: Monserrate Palace is a unique blend of Moorish, Gothic, and Indian architectural styles, set amidst beautifully landscaped gardens. It stands out for its exquisite ornamental details and the romantic atmosphere of its gardens, which feature exotic plants from around the world. The palace is a testament to 19th-century eclecticism and offers a quieter, more serene experience compared to the more frequented sites in Sintra.
sources.shortName: SINTRA, THE MOST ROMANTIC VILLAGE IN PORTUGAL

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs not just one of Portugal‚Äôs most exotic buildings, it‚Äôs one of the finest examples of 19th-century European eclecticism. It‚Äôs a romantic palace that belonged to different millionaires, including English novelist William Beckford. Blending several architectural styles, it‚Äôs surrounded by a wonderful botanical garden, and its oriental-inspired interior has been carefully restored.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Sintra Attractions and Things to Do

sources.snippet: The Palace of Monserrate is marked by an exotic atmosphere and oriental trends. Built by Sir Francis Cook, 1st Viscount of Monserrate, in the romantic style of the time, harmonizing Gothic, Indian and Arab elements in its decoration, it evokes the imagination of a palace of the thousand and one nights. Outside, we can also explore a lush park with exotic species.
sources.shortName: 5 places not to be missed in Sintra

sources.snippet: Monserrate Palace is a dreamy escape for couples, offering an enchanting blend of culture and nature. You'll be enchanted by the palace's unique architecture and the lush gardens, which are a delightful treat for your eyes. The romantic atmosphere is perfect for a leisurely exploration, where you can create unforgettable memories together.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra

sources.snippet: Between Sintra and Colares, immersed in the beauty of the mountain‚Äôs microclimate, is the Palace and botanical garden of Monserrate. Extraordinary and currently restored palace placed on the highest part of a garden that gathers species from all over the world. It‚Äôs another trip through the natural world without leaving Sintra.
sources.siteName: ScannerTrip - Travel Blog | Tips and hints for your vacation
sources.shortName: Sintra: what to visit in this romantic village in Portugal

sources.snippet: Also noteworthy is Monserrate Palace, a masterpiece of romanticism, which combines architectural elements of Moorish, Gothic, Manueline and Renaissance inspiration. The palace is also a museum, which houses works of art from various periods and origins, such as paintings, sculptures, tapestries, furniture and tiles.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Sintra for Couples, 2024

sources.snippet: Cost: 12‚Ç¨Hours:The park is open from 9 am to 7 pm, last entry at 6 pm; the palace is open from 9:30 am to 6 pm, last entry at 5:30 pmWebsite:parquesdesintra.pt. Palace of Monserrate | Best Things to Do in Sintra. The Park and Palace of Monserrate is the most underrated site in Sintra that we visited.
sources.shortName: 13 Amazing Things to Do in Sintra, Portugal (2024 Guide

sources.snippet: The Monserrate Palace and its surrounding gardens boast a diverse collection of plant species worldwide, creating a colorful and scented wonderland that will transport you and your partner to a world of sensory delight. Plus, if you go in the summer, you will love a short break in the shadows‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Portugal: 5 romantic things to do in Sintra

sources.snippet: Monserrate is located 4km from the center of Sintra and is worth the visit. It‚Äôs one of the most amazing creations of the Romantic era in Portugal. Inside the palace you can enjoy the exotic and yet harmonious decoration.
sources.shortName: Sintra, Romantic Portuguese Destinations

sources.snippet: In there, not only you will find a magnificent palace with impressive architectural features, but you will also find a garden, divided into parts and with one of the largest international collections of floral species.
sources.shortName: Sintra: Romance and Magic, just 15 minutes away from Lisbon
Sintra Village is One Of The Most Romantic Places on Earth
The Prettiest F*cking Sintra, Portugal Travel Guide You've Ever Seen‚ÄîAKA: Isn't It Romanti...cism?

places.name: Park and Palace of Monserrate

reviews.text: One of the most beautiful palaces and gardens I ever visited and I am a fan. The carving on the walls inside takes your breath away. The room with 12 muses busts is the most beautifully planned. I am in love with the garden layering and planning, you can see how much work went into making different areas and styles look so organic together. Great place for nature and art lovers. No times slots booking needed. Hop on and hop off buses run until 18:30, park clothes at 19:00. Make sure you can spend 2-3 hours here as the area is huge and the hill on the way back are steep. But it is so much worth your visit, I promise!!

It's a beautiful Palace with a garden. It's the most detailed and impressive one. It's small and less crowded than Pena Palace. I would recommend a visit if you want to avoid the big crowds from Pena Palace and if you are short on time, as you can visit this one in less than 50 minutes. There's a cafeteria there if you want a quick bite.

Parking can be difficult, so be prepared to arrive early.
You can buy tickets on site, no need for advance tickets.

This place is pure magic! The gardens feel like a joyful journey across continents, each one bursting with color and character. The architecture is stunning - graceful, vibrant, and totally awe inspiring. It's one of those spots that lifts your spirits and fills you with wonder. Honestly, it's one of the happiest discoveries I've ever made, an absolute must visit!

places.address: R. Barbosa du Bocage 136, 2710-405 Sintra, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Caf√© Saudade is a historic establishment located in the former Queijadas da Mathilde cheesecake factory, which supplied King Ferdinand II with its famous queijadas de Sintra. The caf√© was meticulously restored using recycled and regional materials, preserving its authenticity. With vibrant decor reflecting Portuguese culture, it has been a beloved gathering spot for generations of Sintra residents since the early 20th century.

sources.snippet: With an amazing choice of pastries, yogurts, coffees, paninis and salads, you won‚Äôt leave here hungry. This is a great place for breakfast or a light lunch. While I didn‚Äôt see a kids menu, there were plenty of options that children would like.
sources.shortName: Guide to the Best of Sintra: How to Spend 1 or 2 Days

sources.snippet: There are restaurants serving typical Sintra cuisine, such as Caf√© Saudade, Taverna dos Trovadores or Estefanea Caf√©, which also have live music and a cosy atmosphere.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Sintra for Couples, 2024

places.name: Caf√© Saudade

reviews.text: This is such an amazing place to have great meals, healthy and nutritious. Their portions are very generous. The food is tasty, delicious and satisfying. Then we came back for tea (great selection of teas) and cakes and by the way the coffee is  excellent. The staff really connect with you and they made our visit memorable. What an incredible atmosphere. Very grateful. Thank you.

My husband and I stopped here for a quick breakfast on our day trip to Sintra as it's conveniently located close to the train station. We were seated at a back room as space was limited.
My best memory however was the large portion sizes of the sandwiches üòÄ which tasted great as well. The wait was a tad longer maybe because of the crowd that day but we enjoyed our experience anyway. We even overheard other people in the room express their happy shock when receiving their huge sandwiches as well and joined in for a laugh üòÖ

This is one of the best caf√©s in the heart of Sintra. They have great options, both food and drinks. I highly recommend the scones, teas, and milkshakes. The atmosphere is lovely, and the different rooms are beautiful, which is why it's so popular with tourists. Parking can be tricky, but it's definitely a must-visit spot for anyone coming to Sintra.

places.address: Av. Dr. Miguel Bombarda 6, 2710-590 Sintra, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Tascantiga is a laid-back restaurant located in the historic center of Sintra, offering a modern twist on traditional Portuguese tapas. The chef, Vitor Paes, puts a creative spin on classic recipes, serving up dishes like confit pork cheeks with mushrooms, fried cuttlefish with aioli, and codfish cakes with olive puree and ham powder. The restaurant also offers outdoor terrace seating where visitors can enjoy their meal while taking in the picturesque surroundings.

sources.snippet: To recover energies for the afternoon tour, we suggest having lunch in our neighboring called tascantiga. You can try the best that Portuguese gastronomy has to offer with the Midas touch from Chef Vitor Paes, a born creative who likes to reinvent the most classic recipes of our country. Cr√©ditos: Tascantiga
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaway in Sintra

sources.snippet: A great little corner spot with several tables outside, along with a large dining room inside. This spot was packed at lunch, so we decided to go back later for a few drinks and tapas before dinner.
sources.shortName: Guide to the Best of Sintra: How to Spend 1 or 2 Days

places.name: Tascantiga

reviews.text: We were fortunate to be in Sintra on a Friday night, one of only 2 nights a week this jewel of a restaurant is open. From the moment we sat down until we left, the experience was the best we have had in Portugal. Our server, Patricia, was the most wonderful, kind and knowledgeable about the food, wine and areas around. The food, wine and port were just fantastic, fresh and local with beautiful presentation. Johnny, one of the other servers also was incredible and we had a great conversation with him. The overall experience is a 12 out of 10! A must try.

Very good quality of food. You should for sure try Octopus as it was super tender. For us, it was the best experience in Portugal so far. Whatever we ordered was very tasty. Especially considering the prices, we were super satisfied with the restaurant. Also the staff were kind and helpful. Planning to go again today :)

We had a lovely experience at Tascantiga in Sintra! We arrived about 15 minutes before they opened and were lucky to get a table on the beautiful terrace with a great view. You order by ticking boxes on the menu - which is fun - and the food was absolutely delicious. We had the Tuna Steak and the Steak Burger, both full of flavor and beautifully cooked. The portions were generous - which you definitely need during a day exploring Sintra. The staff were very fast, friendly, and welcoming. Highly recommend this spot for a quiet, relaxed and tasty meal in a stunning setting!

places.address: Escadinhas da Fonte da Pipa 2, 2710-557 Sintra, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Bacalhau na Vila, located in Sintra, is a fantastic restaurant specializing in the iconic Portuguese dish, bacalhau (salted codfish). The diverse menu offers various delicious preparations of bacalhau, including salted cod soup, croquettes, towers, and salad. Additionally, there's a vegan version available for non-fish eaters. The attentive and friendly staff ensures a pleasant dining experience for families with options for young kids.

sources.snippet: As in all romantic getaways the romantic dinner can not be missed. Try the Bacalhau na Vila!. We are certain that you will be amazed by the best tapas and cod dishes, from traditional to new interpretations.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaway in Sintra

places.name: Bacalhau na Vila

reviews.text:
We are a couple of tourist from Hong Kong, visiting Sintra for the first time.  We found this restaurant in Google map as its good comments, that's truth.
The restaurant is a little and cosy place.  We sat down after half an hour it was almost full house.  The waiters were still very friendly although they were busy.
The traditional codfish dishes here were so delicious which we have never tasted before, absolutely unforgettable.

Bacalhau na Vila is a hidden gem in Sintra, serving the most authentic Portuguese bacalhau dishes! The flavors are incredible, and every bite feels like a taste of tradition. Highly recommend for anyone craving delicious, well-prepared seafood in a cozy setting. A must-visit!
Small and cozy place with a lot of fish. I tried soup, main dish, appetizer and tartas. Everything was super tasty. Definitely recommend to visit if you like to try the codfish.

places.generalDescription: The Casa do Fauno cultural center is a great place to visit if you're looking for something different. It's crammed full of medieval-style architecture, art and carvings, which gives it an air of old-world charm. There are plenty of bars and restaurants here, as well as a library and museum. It all combines to create a truly unique experience that you won't find anywhere else in Portugal.

sources.snippet: There are also bars serving cocktails and snacks, such as Binhoteca, Casa do Fauno or Fonte da Pipa, which also have games and entertainment. And finally, discos that play music for all styles, such as Vip Club, Bliss Club or Club 66, which also have shows and themed parties.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Sintra for Couples, 2024

places.name: Casa do Fauno

reviews.text:
Tucked away in the misty hills of Sintra, Casa do Fauno is nothing short of magical. This medieval-style pub is the perfect refuge on a chilly evening, offering a warm, welcoming atmosphere that feels like stepping into another time. The crackling fireplace, rustic decor, and soft medieval melodies create an unmatched vibe-cozy, mysterious, and deeply comforting.

The food is simple but fantastic. Their toasties are perfectly crisp and satisfying, making them the ideal companion to a cold night. But the real highlights here are the drinks-a rich selection of teas to warm the soul and mead that transports you straight into a medieval feast. The mead is smooth, slightly sweet, and dangerously easy to sip.

Beyond the food and ambiance, the people make this place truly special. The staff are welcoming, passionate, and full of great recommendations, adding to the sense of being a guest in a magical hidden tavern. Whether you're stopping by after exploring Sintra's mystical landscapes or seeking an atmospheric escape, Casa do Fauno is an unforgettable experience-a must-visit for lovers of history, comfort, and a truly unique night out.

Casa do Fauno is a perfect oasis to escape the madness of the crowds in Sintra! I practically had the whole place to myself! The beer and food offerings are limited, but what they do have is delicious! I highly recommend sitting outside in their little garden with a beverage in hand and take in the chill atmosphere!

Such a cool spot in Sintra! Great selection of drinks including NA teas, delicious mulled wine, ok coffee, mead, a few decent beers. Toast sandwich was tasty and the servers and bartenders are lovely and friendly. Rustic outdoor seating with a pretty backdrop from the park and medieval style indoor seating with classic decor. Love this spot.

places.generalDescription: The Chalet of the Countess of Edla is a 19th-century Alpine chalet-inspired house and gardens built by King Fernando II. It's located in Sintra Nature Reserve, offering walking trails with diverse plant varieties and stunning views of Pena Palace and Sintra Mountains from Santa Eufemia Viewpoint. For adventurous visitors, there are challenging trails leading to Capuchos Convent or Cabo da Roca with dinosaur footprints.

sources.snippet: Built in the 19th century by King Ferdinand II for his second wife, the Countess of Edla, this chalet  follows the model of the Alpine chalets of the time. Inside, a decorative stucco mural painting stands out, as does the wall cladding with inlaid cork and wood panels. The romantic garden has a botanical collection with hundreds of species, including native vegetation and exotic specimens from all over the world .
sources.shortName: Sintra: 16 Must-see Sites

sources.snippet: Ride around Pena Park in a horse-drawn carriage ride which takes you from the Lakes Valley to the Chalet of the Countess of Edla with its famous Lace Room. Another surprisingly peaceful park to explore is the Quita da Regaleira, a four-hectare estate with tunnels, mazes, grottos and water features.
sources.shortName: A couple‚Äôs guide to Sintra ‚Äì Portugal‚Äôs most romantic city

places.name: Chalet of the Countess of Edla

reviews.text: The place is very nice, a bit of a walk from the main Palace but worth it. You can check the beautiful park and see some additional attractions on your walk to the chalet.

Really neat building, but it's a pretty long hike from the main palace. The bark decoration is pretty spectacular. It's not clear whether it's possible to go inside; we got there quite late in the day, the doors were locked, and there was no one else around.
Beautiful but we were harassed by the guard due to not carrying our tickets. Such a stupid rule. As if people can sneak into this park.

sources.snippet: Perhaps because it only opened to the public in 2022, the Pal√°cio Biester still slips under the radar for many Sintra visitors. Together with its better-known (and busier) neighbor Quinta da Regaleira, this property, dating from the 19th century, is a textbook example of the romantic architecture that characterizes the buildings hidden within the dense Sintra forest.
sources.shortName: Top 10 things to do in Sintra

reviews.text: Literally a breath of fresh air when you are used to the other palaces. This is the way it should be when visiting such a place. We had a lovely walk throught the gardens, hearing the birds and sometimes being followed by some ‚Äòcheeky' cats. Lovely visit overall, would 100% recommend. It was our best palace experience that day.
Absolutely incredible palace. There was also no crowds around 5:30pm, and I had the whole place to myself. 10/10 recommend! Make sure to climb to the overlook view point as well for incredible views.

What a beautiful Garden! It reminded me for some reason about the beauty & the beast castle. I love how much effort was put in the garden and each individual section. It took us about 2 hours to look at everything and enjoy all the different view points and plants. Unfortunately some of the garden was closed off due to some fallen trees. But we most definitely will be back to explore the rest. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

places.generalDescription: Dona Estef√¢nia - F√°brica de Queijadas e Travesseiros de Sintra is a must-visit destination for food enthusiasts in Sintra, Portugal. The place offers traditional Portuguese dishes like 'Bacalhau a Bras' and the famous 'Travesseiros,' along with an opportunity to explore the local wine culture.

sources.snippet: Leaving Sintra without tasting the greatest representatives of convent sweets is, like going to Rome and not seeing the Pope. There are several typical sweets but the most famous and with the surname of Sintra are the Queijadas and Sintra travesseiros. The queijadas are made with fresh cheese, sugar, flour and cinnamon and are disputed by two typical houses, the Fabrica das Verdadeiras Queijadas da Sapa and the Casa Piriquita.
sources.siteName: ScannerTrip - Travel Blog | Tips and hints for your vacation
sources.shortName: Sintra: what to visit in this romantic village in Portugal

places.name: Dona Estef√¢nia - F√°brica de Queijadas e Travesseiros de Sintra

reviews.text: I had an amazing breakfast here! Both the sweets and savories were delicious, and the staff was incredibly friendly. They took the time to explain the dishes to us, making our experience even better. Highly recommend this place for a tasty and welcoming start to the day!
Always a long line in the shop, everything's fresh and they have plenty of seating. Had the tart that originated from Sintra. Has more cinnamon flavors in it but also a lot sweeter
One of the most amazing pastries we've ever had, we got them super fresh and warm, straight from the oven. The service was amazing as well

places.address: R. Tom√© de Barros Queir√≥s n¬∫25 A, 2710-624 Sintra, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Monument perched high in the hills, offering views of Palacio de Pena & surrounding gardens.

sources.shortName: Sintra Village is One Of The Most Romantic Places on Earth

places.name: High Cross

reviews.text:
The experience was incredibly tranquil, with far fewer visitors compared to the bustling Pena Palace, making it feel like a hidden retreat. The trek itself was delightful, winding through towering trees adorned with lichens that added a touch of timeless beauty. The crisp, fresh air invigorated every step, and the soothing sounds of small waterfalls cascading down the rocks created a serene soundtrack to the journey.

As you ascend, the lush greenery envelopes you, offering pockets of shade and moments to pause and appreciate nature's magnificence. Reaching the top feels like a reward, with sweeping, panoramic views of the entire city sprawling beneath you. The journey is as enriching as the destination, a perfect escape into nature's embrace.

(2025/4/17) FYI there is zero view of the Palace at the moment. Completely c'blocked by trees. The view of other shiz is nice but don't come here expecting those postcard pix like I did lol. Couldn't find ‚ÄúTea Hill‚Äù either so best distance view of the palace I got was from the Moorish Castle which was pretty solid.
Cruz Alta was nice, but we really wanted a full view of Pena Palace from afar. Too bad, though, because we hiked so far and hardly saw anything, tons of trees blocked the view.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the forested mountain range of Sintra, this picturesque town is a must-visit destination just a day trip away from Lisbon. With over ten national monuments including palaces and ancient ruins, it offers a rich historical experience and stunning photo opportunities. The area is easily accessible by public transportation from Lisbon.

sources.snippet: Nestled in the foothills of the Sintra Mountains, the former royal sanctuary of Sintra is surrounded by forest walks and filled with UNESCO-listed palaces and pastel-coloured villas. Take a romantic horse-drawn carriage tour around the cobblestone streets and see the highlights of this heritage city. You‚Äôll be introduced to turreted castles, clock towers, grand pal√°cio, parks and gardens designed for strolling hand-in-hand.
sources.shortName: A couple‚Äôs guide to Sintra ‚Äì Portugal‚Äôs most romantic city

sources.snippet: The town of Sintra and its palaces would not be the same without the Serra de Sintra. The Romans called it Mons Lunae. Monte da Lua, and this mysticism, still exists today.
sources.shortName: Sintra: 16 Must-see Sites

places.name: Sintra Mountains

reviews.text: One of the most beautiful hikes I've ever done. Carry a rain coat even if Google says no rain, trusting your intuition. Probably my first hike when it was also raining. The mist covered the view. Yet, it was so beautiful. There is a cafe which sells water, soft drinks, chips and popcorn. Seemed to be dog friendly except for the mini museum. Wear comfy shoes. Took a bus to return after finishing the sintra palace and the Pena palace.
The most magical place We've ever visited! The sunset was incredible to watch! We fell in love with Sintra!

The Serra de Sintra has always been one my favourite places to hike every time I go to Portugal (most summers and a couple of Christmases in the last 20 years). Almost every time I discover and explore a new path, a new corner, etc. It's just a great place to get away and be with nature.

places.generalDescription: Taverna dos Trovadores is a cozy spot where you can enjoy both white and red wine at any time of the day or night. The bar also serves traditional Portuguese cuisine, with a focus on grilled meats. Live music performances, often featuring fado, add to the authentic Portuguese atmosphere. Nestled in a quiet corner of picturesque Sintra, this gem of a restaurant offers amazing food and an impressive selection of wines. The attentive and friendly staff contribute to the welcoming ambiance.

sources.snippet: There are restaurants serving typical Sintra cuisine, such as Caf√© Saudade, Taverna dos Trovadores or Estefanea Caf√©, which also have live music and a cosy atmosphere.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Sintra for Couples, 2024

places.name: Taverna dos Trovadores

reviews.text:
We came here because one random guy recommended it to us. I have never eaten anything better in my life! Absolutely delicious ü§§ the dish is called Bacalhau com natas (chef's dish)
The prices were decent and the service amazing! Enjoy and thank our random guy from the beach later üåä

Was a nice visit but found the options not so kid friendly.

The menu had a bit too many pizzas and was a bit hard to park as well.
Expected a bit more from the menu suggestions. Great wine list.
Some waiters didn't speak Portuguese and that being in Portugal makes the experience slightly weird.
Price way above the range of the food

I was looking for a restaurant in Sintra that does Fado and this one promised live music every Friday and Saturday night, so I booked it in advance but to my disappointment there was no music üò¢ their sign even says live music.
The kids said the pizza was good, but my octopus was rather bland and a bit overcooked. My husband had the picanha and it was very thin pieces of meat and not much flavour.
The last disappointing thing was the wine, we ordered the green wine on tap and there was something floating in the bottom of the jar. My husband was totally disgusted by that and it ruined his whole meal.
For the prices we paid, I would have expected better quality and some live music would have been nice.

places.address: Pra√ßa Dom Fernando II 18, 2710-483 Sintra, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of the Sintra forest and Moon Hills, Capuchos Convent, also known as the Cork Convent, is a must-see destination when visiting Sintra. Built in the 16th century by ascetic monks following the principles of poverty, this compact Medieval convent used cork to line its small spaces. Despite being abandoned since the 1830s, wandering through its ruins still exudes an atmosphere of peace and tranquility.

sources.snippet: Surrounded by nature and far from the gardens and palaces is the old Capuchos Convent. This one, devoid of any luxury and perfectly framed in the landscape, was the residence of Franciscan friars until the extinction of the religious orders. More About CAPUCHOS CONVENT (press Here)
sources.siteName: ScannerTrip - Travel Blog | Tips and hints for your vacation
sources.shortName: Sintra: what to visit in this romantic village in Portugal

places.name: Capuchos Convent

reviews.text: I want to come back here and spend hours exploring the areas and quietly contemplating the people who lived here. Very quiet and remote. It felt like sacred ground.

Such a magical place. We bought tickets for a night guided tour. It was amazing. It was beyond our expectations. Even to get there was an adventure.I think everyone owes this place a visit just to see monks humble  lifestyle and their respect for the nature. Beautiful and sad at the same time.
Guide Bertrand was very passionate and interesting. Highly recommended.

If you are interested in History related to prayer & devotion..
Seeing how the friars lived, there devotion to faith is exceptional..üôè
